intro: Sebastiania rigida, commonly known as the rigid sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and waxy, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Sebastiania rigida is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
